text: I'm Andrew Knowlton the restaurant and
drinks editor upon Appetit the Manhattan
is in my opinion the greatest cocktail

today I'm going to show you how to make
it first you're gonna need a mixing
glass a pint glass or anything like that
will work fine
Manhattan's are classically stirred
cocktails as opposed to drinks that
we're safe general rule on those
anything that's just all spirits you can
go ahead and stir if you have fruit
juice or cream or anything like that
then you want to shake so let's get to
it
first you're gonna need some rye whiskey
if you have bourbon whiskey that's
totally fine as well three ounces of rye
whiskey just in a measuring glass or a
[ __ ] some sweet vermouth the red stuff
bounce and a half of that and last but
not least the most important ingredient
you could argue is bitters and this is
what they leave out at lesser bars but
make sure they do have it I'm just gonna
put two dashes of Angostura just want
some good ice cubes the bigger the
better and then you're just gonna stir
once the glass starts frosting around
the edges usually indicates it's cold
enough the real nerds out there say a
perfect Manhattan needs to be 38 degrees
Fahrenheit so that looks about right and
then you just need a frosted cocktail
glass I like the classic coupe glasses
and then you're gonna strain it with a
Hawthorne strainer the classic garnish
would be a cherry I'd just like a little
bit of an orange twist squeeze it and
rub it around so that when you drink the

you get some of those orange flavors so
there you go a classic Manhattan
